info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 7:41AM EDT until April 6 at 11:00AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh PA
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Ohio...
Tuscarawas River Above New Philadelphia affecting Tuscarawas County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Tuscarawas River above New Philadelphia.
* WHEN...From this afternoon to Sunday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 7.5 feet, Water reaches outbuilding of one mobile home on Pine Lane. At 8.0 feet, Water begins to affect several mobile homes along Pine Lane. The ballfields at Waterworks Field Recreation Area are flooded. Water overspreades parking lot of Smith's Dairy at the end of Cookson Avenue.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 7.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 7.6 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 7.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.6 feet on 06/14/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz.
The next statement will be issued this evening at 800 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO SUNDAY MORNING
